reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Small, Yet Significant Upgrade to My Webcam
reviews.reviewText: I use an Anker PowerConf C200 webcam for work and based on my monitor setup and their height, resting it along the top edge of either screen was not ideal. However, I have some space between the monitors and place the camera there. The problem is the camera itself does not have a solid base and it's highly prone to movement.This tripod solves that problem. It offers stability, protects the base of the camera from scuffs/scratching, is easy to use, and overall is a cheap upgrade. I've very happy with it and just ordered another one for a Logitech webcam that I also use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great so far
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to go on an e-call for hunting and it works great its about 4 inches and the legs pull out to make it taller. Seems pretty sturdy and well priced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for desktop use
reviews.reviewText: With all the Zoom meetings and classes, this has been wonderful. We can place the camera at the angle of our choosing and not straight off the monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I use small tripods for video-conversations on my phone and I need them to be portable (small and light) and stable (to use on various surfaces). I got tired of all those plastic ones breaking, so I decided to try this metal one. While it seems like it will be much more durable (I've only had it for a week), it has other shortcomings:* The legs open at a very small angle, thus making it very unstable once the phone is attached to the top, especially in portrait orientation. Even when they are extended (which makes it even taller and inconvenient), it takes a lot of adjustment just to keep is standing on hard, flat surface.* The ball-head tightening mechanism can keep it in place but it is not progressive in effort and, thus, makes it hard to control the tightness. Also, the head of the wingnut is very small, exacerbating this problem. As a result, I often end up not tightening it enough and it tends to tilt and fall upon the slightest touch.Time will tell whether it is as robust as it appears, but it is hard to use and I may just have to keep looking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Size and compatibility
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this for my wife and I on our date nights. We sit outside and watch movies. I usually use books and other stuff to keep the mini projector straight. I ordered this taking a chance. And it worked out great. It's a little shorter than I thought but worked out great.

reviews.reviewText: It stands up real well. I like that I can extend the legs and it holds up my camera really well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight Tripod for Small Cameras and Smartphones
reviews.reviewText: This Lightweight Mini Tripod from Amazon Basics was a life saver, I had bought this product back in November of 2017 and I am now in 2023, and I honestly think it's worth the money, or at least in my personal opinion. I have used this small yet durable tripod for years and it has not failed me at all. I did eventually buy a (SMARTPHONE HOLDING MECHANISM) (NOT INCLUDED) to screw onto the tripod, which you can buy separately. I have used this tripod to take pictures, either for social media or to promote my art on YouTube. I believe this tripod can be used in many ways, I have used it to record side views of my art process and also to use it on a daily basis to take still photos of nature and trips I've been on in the past. I also provided some photos included in this review to showcase the tripod in itself. Remember to pull on the rubber bumpers at the bottom of the tripod, trust me I thought it was a one height only mini tripod, but I was fooled, and I did not realize it had extending legs, so watch out for the unexpected height scare. Overall, I think this product is worth it, it is easy to use for timed photography or for social media projects/businesses. This is not a tall tripod, but it's a great alternative for anyone wanting to take pictures/videos for vlogging by setting the tripod on a table. Thank you all for reading. Happy Shopping! I hope I'll help you all with this honest review! ;)

Lo compramos para un viaje en pareja y nos funcionó perfecto para esos lugares donde no encuentras quien te pueda tomar una foto, es pequeño por lo que cabe muy bien en la mochila o la bolsa de mano.La construcción se siente sólida al ser de metal.El único inconveniente que le encuentro es que no trae el accesorio para sujetar el celular.Atención, por ser pequeño es mas bien para ponerlo sobre una silla, mesa, o superficie alta.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The parcel was just dumped at my door, no ringing the door bell or knocking to let me know, not even a text or an email. It was a neighbour who knocked to let me know. I'm luck it wasn't stolen. Disgusting delivery service.The lightweight mini tripod for the price seems to have good build quality, the legs extend but do not lock, they is enough resistance to support my TG-6 camera. The legs when collapse make it pocket sized (to match my TG-6), unfortunately the legs do not adjust out to give a lower platform. I am happy with it. Good price.
